org.lwjgl.ovr

Class OVRInputState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.PointerWrapper
      • org.lwjgl.system.Struct
        • org.lwjgl.ovr.OVRInputState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pointer

    public class OVRInputState
extends Struct
    Describes the complete controller input state, including Oculus Touch, and XBox gamepad. If multiple inputs are connected and used at the same time, their inputs are combined.

    ovrInputState members

    MemberTypeDescription
    TimeInSecondsdoublesystem type when the controller state was last updated
    ConnectedControllerTypesunsigned intdescribed by ovrControllerType. Indicates which ControllerTypes are present.
    Buttonsunsigned intvalues for buttons described by ovrButton
    Touchesunsigned inttouch values for buttons and sensors as described by ovrTouch.
    IndexTriggerfloat[2]left and right finger trigger values (OVR.ovrHand_Left and OVR.ovrHand_Right), in the range 0.0 to 1.0f.
    HandTriggerfloat[2]left and right hand trigger values (OVR.ovrHand_Left and OVR.ovrHand_Right), in the range 0.0 to 1.0f.
    ThumbstickovrVector2f[2]horizontal and vertical thumbstick axis values (OVR.ovrHand_Left and OVR.ovrHand_Right), in the range -1.0f to 1.0f.

      • OVRInputState

      • OVRInputState

        public OVRInputState(java.nio.ByteBuffer container)
        Creates a OVRInputState instance at the current position of the specified ByteBuffer container. Changes to the buffer's content will be visible to the struct instance and vice versa.

        The created instance holds a strong reference to the container object.
